net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.field

Class UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetComposite<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.UiWidgetCustom<VALUE,DELEGATE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.field.UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE>
  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value. Typically a custom Datatype.
    DELEGATE - is the generic type of the delegate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadTrimValue, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadValueAsString, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteTrimValue, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteValueAsString, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidgetField<VALUE>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetRegularComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetWithValue<VALUE>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetCustomFieldAtomic, UiWidgetCustomFieldComposite

    public abstract class UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetComposite<?>>
extends UiWidgetCustom<VALUE,DELEGATE>
implements UiWidgetField<VALUE>
    This is the abstract base class for a custom widget that is a field widget. The major usecase is to create field widgets for custom Datatype based on existing field widgets.
    Instead of extending this class directly you should rather extend one of its sub-classes.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    UiWidgetFactoryDatatype.createForDatatype(Class)

      • getValueAsString

        public String getValueAsString()
        This method gets the value as String. It returns the value as it is entered by the end-user that may be invalid.
        Specified by:
        getValueAsString in interface AttributeReadValueAsString
        Returns:
        the value as entered by the user. Will be the empty String if the field is blank.

      • getFirstField

        This method gets the first active field contained in this custom field. This can be the delegate itself but also a child of the delegate in case of a composite custom field.

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel()
        This method gets the label of this object. A label is some text that is permanently shown to the user in the UI in order to describe the meaning of the object and in particular its value. For elements that allow to display or edit a value the label is typically shown beside the edit/display widget. For action elements such as buttons or links the label is the actual text (lettering).

        NOTE:
        Every field widget (UiWidgetField) has an associated label widget. This method gets its label text. Please note that the label widget is not contained in this field widget itself, so if you regularly add this field widget to some other widget you will not see the label. However, UiWidgetGridPanel also automatically adds the label widget. The recommended use-case is to create a form to view and edit your business object extending UiWidgetCustomGridPanel and use UiDataBinding.
        Unlike UiWidgetField.getLabelWidget().getLabel() this method prevents actually creating the label widget if it does NOT yet exist. Further it will only return what has been set via UiWidgetField.setLabel(String) and NOT what has potentially been set via UiWidgetField.getLabelWidget() . setLabel (what should be avoided).
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface AttributeReadLabel
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface UiWidgetField<VALUE>
        Returns:
        the label text. Will be the empty string if no label has been set.

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(String label)
        This method sets the label of this object.
        Specified by:
        setLabel in interface AttributeWriteLabel
        Specified by:
        setLabel in interface UiWidgetField<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        label - is the new label to set.
        See Also:
        UiWidgetField.getLabel()

      • getLabelWidget

        public UiWidgetLabel getLabelWidget()
        This method gets the label widget associated with this field.
        ATTENTION:
        Depending on the underlying toolkit the label widget is lazily created on the first call of this method. Additionally users of this API (unlike implementors of the API) may only use this for very specific cases (e.g. setting the style of the label). Therefore you should avoid calling this method unless you are aware of what you are doing. To access the label-text simply use UiWidgetField.getLabel() and UiWidgetField.setLabel(String). Be aware that some native toolkits (e.g. SmartGWT) already implement field widgets including the label. In this case this method will return a different view on the same native widget.
        Specified by:
        getLabelWidget in interface UiWidgetField<VALUE>
        Returns:
        the associated label widget.

      • getChildIndex

        public int getChildIndex(UiWidget child)
        This method determines the index of the given child in the list of children of this composite.
        The signature is by intention not using the generic to support delegation without suffering by the java compiler.
        Specified by:
        getChildIndex in interface UiWidgetAbstractComposite
        Parameters:
        child - is the potential child.
        Returns:
        the index of the given child or -1 if it is NOT a child of this composite.
        See Also:
        List.indexOf(Object)

      • setFocused

        public boolean setFocused()
        This method sets the focus to this object.
        NOTE:
        You can only set the focus. To actually remove it, you need to set it in a different widget. Further, as an API user you can normally ignore the result. This is only relevant for composite widgets such as panels, that delegate the call recursively and may not contain any child that can take the focus.
        Specified by:
        setFocused in interface AttributeWriteOnlyFocused
        Overrides:
        setFocused in class UiWidgetCustom<VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetComposite<?>>
        Returns:
        true if the focus has been set successfully, false otherwise.

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        This method determines if this object currently has the focus. In this case the cursor is placed in the object (e.g. a text input) and it will receive keyboard events.
        Specified by:
        isFocused in interface AttributeReadFocused
        Returns:
        true if this object is focused, false otherwise.

        public boolean removeFocusHandler(UiHandlerEventFocus handler)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        handler - is the UiHandlerEventFocus to remove.
        Returns:

      • setAccessKey

        public void setAccessKey(char accessKey)
        This method sets the accessKey attribute of this object.
        Specified by:
        setAccessKey in interface AttributeWriteAccessKey
        Parameters:
        accessKey - is the new value of AttributeReadAccessKey.getAccessKey(). Use AttributeReadAccessKey.ACCESS_KEY_NONE to unset.

      • getAccessKey

        public char getAccessKey()
        This method gets the access key of this object. If the access key is pressed together with the [shift] and [alt] keys this object will be invoked. Here invoked means the same as if the end-user would click on the object. In case of an action item (button, link, etc.) it is invoked, otherwise it will get the focus.
        Specified by:
        getAccessKey in interface AttributeReadAccessKey
        Returns:
        the access key. Will be AttributeReadAccessKey.ACCESS_KEY_NONE if no access key is defined.

      • setValidationFailure

        public void setValidationFailure(String validationFailure)
        This method sets the validation failure.
        ATTENTION:
        For regular usage you should use UiFeatureValidation. This method is only intended as back-door for very special cases (e.g. you have to use your own validator infrastructure and perform validation outside this framework). It is not recommended to use this method as an API user.
        Specified by:
        setValidationFailure in interface AttributeWriteValidationFailure
        Parameters:
        validationFailure - is the validation failure text. The empty string or null will clear the error and mark the field as valid. Otherwise the field will be invalid.

      • getValidationFailure

        public String getValidationFailure()
        This method gets the validation failure of this object. This is a text that explains the user why the value he has entered is invalid (typically provided as tooltip of an error icon).
        Specified by:
        getValidationFailure in interface AttributeReadValidationFailure
        Returns:
        the validation error text or null for no error.
